args:
The Empire has taken control of a sylvan
village nestled deep in the woods—but a young
girl named Melsa manages to escape
and comes to the Halidom seeking aid.
Under her guidance, the prince's retinue
makes its way toward the besieged town.
At this rate, something terrible will...\nI must...tell them.
They must not try to rescue me!
Your Highness, you must hurry to the\ncastle gate at once!
A sylvan girl has come seeking aid.
Apparently the Empire occupied a nearby\nvillage and she just managed to escape.
Got it. Let's go see what we can do.
Please, Highness, you must save my\nvillage. I beg it of you!
The sylvan girl's name is Melsa, and her village\nwas recently overrun by the Empire.
Because they surrendered as soon as the attack\nbegan, there were few lives lost, and the village's\nabsorption into the Empire was largely peaceful.

...Well, I'm glad to hear there wasn't
further damage done. But we still have to
come up with a battle plan and retake
the village.
You seem exhausted. It looks like you\nmight collapse at any second.
I am well. It's merely that I ran all the way\nhere without eating or drinking anything.\n...Er, for roughly two days.
Two days?! That's awful! You need to rest\nin the castle before we do anything else.
No. What's most important is that we hurry\nand save my village. Now let me show...\nLet me show you the...
Wait. I remember now. I came to the\ncastle to beg your assistance, and then...
Oh, no! I can't just be lying about!\nWe must make for the village at once!
Easy there! You still need to rest.\nYou can guide us to the village\nonce you're able to move again.

I understand why you're in such a hurry,
but your village is still standing, and we
need to prepare carefully if we're going
to successfully liberate it.
And on that note, I'll take care of making\npreparations for our departure. Think you\ncan handle it from here, Sarisse?
Yep! I just brought some food, so we're\nall good here.
Okay, you. Time to chow down and start\nregaining that lost strength.
...I suppose you're right. I apologize for\nbeing so overeager.
Oh, and I am Melsa. Might I ask your\nname?
Sarisse! And lemme tell ya, Melsa,\nit's nice to have another sylvan around.
Oh, um, yes. You are a sylvan, aren't you?
HELLOOOO! Check the giant ears!\nC'mon, it couldn't BE more obvious.
No, of course. I merely was surprised to\nfind another of my kind here.
The people in my village hardly ever leave\nits borders, so...
Oh yeah, my village is the same way.\nI think that's standard sylvan behavior.
But Luca—he's my brother—says that\ncustom is super dated and old-fashioned.
So that's why he left town, made friends\nwith the prince, and got us a sweet gig\nhere at the Halidom.
Remarkable. I fear that I could never be\nquite so proactive.
Aw, it's nothing that impressive.\nHonestly, my brother's a big idiot.
There's no telling WHAT ridiculous thing he\nmight do if I wasn't around.
I'm actually here to keep an eye on him\nso our parents don't worry themselves\ninto a coma.
You're a very kind person, Sarisse.
Huh? What? No! Knock it off!
I mean, Luca's always going off about what\na crude dude I am!
Anyway, if anyone is kind here, it's you!
Oh? Do you really think so?

Girl, you ran and ran for two straight days
to help your village! I could never do
something like that; my little stick legs
would totally give out first.
So quit talking about how remarkable my\ndumb brother is and start talking yourself\nup a little, maybe.
Two days... Augh, that's right! I can't\nbelieve so much time has passed\nsince the Empire attacked!
I can sit here and converse no longer;\nI must leave at once!
That's because you're still on death's door,\nweirdo! Now get back to your room and\ntake that rest already.
Well, I...guess that would be best.
Look, I know how hard you struggled to\nmake it all the way here, Melsa.
But you don't have to do all this alone,\nokay? If you need help, just ask me!
Thank you. But I will be all right.
Still, I've been nothing but trouble for you\nsince I got here, and for that I apologize.
You sure do apologize a lot...\nOh, hey! I've got an idea!
Yeah! If we're besties, then you can stop\nacting all formal and apologizing for\neverything all the time!
But...my coming to this castle was...
Don't you WANT to be besties with me?
N-no! Er, I mean, yes! Wait, I mean...\nOh, this is coming out all wrong.
It would be lovely to be your friend,\nSarisse. Or even your ＂bestie.＂
Great! Then from here on out, you and me\nare best friends!
Best friends it is, then.\nThank you, Sarisse.
Thanks to all of you, I have recovered and\ncan now guide you to my village.
You realize this isn't some happy field trip,\nright, Sis?
He's right, Sarisse. You will face grave\ndanger if you accompany us.
Which is exactly WHY I'm coming!\nI can't just sit around eating bon-bons\nwhile my bestie is in danger.
Plus, I can fight fiends. ...Tell her, Luca.\nTell her how good I am with a bow.
I can vouch for that. I've even heard Luca\nsay Sarisse might be a better archer than\nhe is—which is saying something.
Okay, let's not go overboard here...
Anyway, it doesn't matter now. Once\nmy sister's mind is made up, there's\nno way to change it.
I wonder who I get THAT from?!
In that case, it's time for us to go.\nOur destination lies deep in those woods.
